title: Reading: Lila - An Inquiry into Morals - By Robert M. Pirsig - Chapter 10
description: It seems the Quality that Lila sees is not the Captain's at all. Still, they're together til the end of the world.

transcript_parts.text: hi there this is lila and inquiry into

there was something wrong with it it was
that rubbery taste in the water

how much she spent she wondered she

then she remembered he paid for most of

yesterday she was going to florida on

she knew it she used to at least plan

now everything happened without any

she thought the kind that never liked

she

i was watching you she said when just
now

not say a word and i think he was really

yes that's the way i am too after a
while
she saw there was all sorts of stuff

what's all that in the water she asked
it's from the hurricane he said
we seem to hit thick patches of it and

it looks awful lila said they were
talking about it back in castleton he
added
they said everything's been coming down
the river trees garbage cans old picnic

a lot of it's half submerged one of the
reasons i'm using the sails
is so we don't hit anything with the

when we get to the mountain up there the

things
we'll have to stop sailing and run the

the river seemed to run right into some

added
a few minutes went by and then she saw

out of the water it looked like some

they got closer and she saw it was a dog
it was all swelled up and it was on its

two of its feet up in the air she didn't

the captain didn't say anything either
later after they got it
she could smell it and she knew he could

if you irrigate land without drainage it

nothing grows the rivers keep the land

all of this debris is on the same

where what do you mean to the ocean oh

how soon will we be there lyla asks

she really didn't know what anybody to

they were probably all gone by now she

is your buyer going to be there what

not me i'm going to florida florida she

she said i thought you said you were

i'm going to florida you must have heard

no i want to get south of cape hatteras

the full storms are in now and these

even the light on the sand was different

you're going to go all by yourself she

i'll get food in florida there are all

good seafood pompano shrimp and snapper
she sure could go for some of that now
oh she shouldn't think about it
you need a cook she said you don't cook
you need someone to cook
i get along he said once she went shrimp

under a bridge with lights and
afterwards they all cooked the shrimp
and took it to the beach and drank cold

oh they were good she could remember how

and they were also stuffed and they laid

and they talked and they all made love

she wondered where they were now those

and the boats she thought the boats were

how long will it take you she asks a

that's a long time how long have you

since august 11th are you retired i'm a

what do you write about traveling mostly
i guess he said
i go places and see things and think

then i write about that there are lots

you mean you would write about what

why would anyone want to write about
this nothing is happening
there's always something happening he
said when you say nothing is happening
you're just saying
nothing is happening that fits your
cliche of what something is
what it's hard to explain he said
something is happening right now
and you think it's unimportant because
you've never seen a movie of it
but if you saw three movies in a row of
people sailing down the hudson river and
maybe a tv documentary about washington
irving
and the history of the hudson river and
then you got on this trip you'd say
boy this sure is something because what
you were seeing
fit some mental picture you already had
planted in your mind
lyla didn't know what that was all about
he said it like he thought he was pretty

she looked at him for a long time and
wondered whether to say something but

she watched the water pass under her

you want to have a really good dinner

i'll make it lila said you will we'll

and you just watch how i cook them is it
a deal you don't have to he said
no that's all right she said i can cook
i just
love to cook cooking is one of my

she looked at the shirt he was wearing
there was a big food spot
over the front pocket she wondered how

he hadn't changed shirts for days i'm

in new york she said
he smiled a little she thought some more
about florida
after a while she turned to him and

what the captain asks i'll show you she

got out her suitcase spread it on the

inside one corner pocket was a bundle of

she untied the ribbon and removed the

lila spread the picture out and

that had got folded over she brought it

and sat down next to the captain and

she hung on it hard so it wouldn't blow

that's the boat i was on in fort
lauderdale florida
three years ago she said with my
girlfriend see where the x is
that's where we used to sit the boat
looked like a great big beautiful

she knew everything about that boat

many times the sky was sort of a pink

with big cottony clouds blowing by in

the boat left just before sunset and

all the flags on the boat were

that was the trade wind and all around

and the water was pink and blue all

with ripples from the breeze that's the

the picture looked so real you wanted to

evening come aboard our new 550

things like my grandfather's house where

things like that they don't really mean

the all-you-wish to eat dinner the

she could have been my sister i wish she

at first everyone was so stuffed with

she had dark hair really beautiful dark

and she had what you would call a

she really liked everybody who was there

there's just one thing someone like him

one more night but she didn't want to

they were very close now some music from

where did that go so fast jamie would

just to see him again the way he used to

that's all she wanted and a little money

mindy might know perhaps she was gone

no one ever stayed any place long she'd

she wondered what that old place looked

they would play an old slow one like

the way he held his hands on her the way

it all came back with the music she was
a real princess then
but she didn't know it lila she could

you've got something on your mind i can

and then after a while she'd just tell

and he'd never argue with her no matter

she was crazy to leave she never should

even with two sweaters on lila was still

she remembered now that she'd had one

went to the front of the boat took the

the shaking of her hands was getting

and there wasn't anything she could do

when she could scream or hit somebody or

then sometimes the wave would stop she

she listened to the sound of the wind

so quiet so different from the karma
she wondered what she would do in

waitressing probably she wasn't much

she'd find somebody she always did she

sydney was the kind you always knew was

he was always supposed to be so nice but
you could never talk to him really
he was always looking down on you and he

that's the kind her mother always wanted

the captain had the same expression like

sydney was a pediatrician now making

she had heard see her mother would say
oh god not her
why was that her mother appeared when

the men her mother liked were always
rich
like the captain here and sydney they

she shouldn't think that about her
mother she shouldn't think about her
mother at all
it was coming the wave was coming the

the captain wasn't sydney though he was

really strange like he knew something he

when she danced with him last night she

like he was somebody else he got real
light like he didn't weigh anything at

he knew something she wished she could
remember
what he'd said he talked about some
indians
and he said something about good and

there was something else it had
something to do with her grandfather's
house
she tried to remember her grandfather
always talked about good and evil
he was a preacher something to do with
the captain the way he looked at the
dead dog and didn't say anything
no he did say something he said they
were all going to where the dog was
going
on her grandfather's wall she remembered
now
there'd been a great big picture in his

where a man was standing in a boat going

at the bottom it said something in
german her grandfather said it meant
island of the dead that her grandfather
was dead
and she always thought of him as going
to that island where lucky was
lucky met him when he got there
he was always talking about good and
evil and how she would go to hell for
her sins if she wasn't good
the boatman was taking people across the

to the island because they had sinned
lucky her black and white dog
he looked just like that dog today
floating with his two feet up in the air
why did she remember it now that picture
burned up
in a fire when her grandfather's house

that's why god burned her grandfather's
house down to send him to hell
it was all mixed up nothing makes any

nothing ever did but now it was worse
who was he
she wondered everything seemed so dreamy
like she didn't really belong here there
was something wrong with her
she knew there was but nobody would tell

she listened to the wind it was getting
louder the boat was
tipping more and more on its side
why was this river so empty why was this

weren't they supposed to be getting near

why was the wind getting louder the
people
along the bank of the river they never

it was if they couldn't even see the
boat
a sudden gust of wind hit and the boat

he couldn't see she was watching him and
his face was sad
and serious as though he was at a

as though he was carrying a coffin
something was wrong
something terrible was coming something
was going to happen
it couldn't go on like this she could
just feel it in her bones it was coming
seeing that dog like that in the water
it looked like lucky why should he come

she knew they were coming to that place

what did the captain say it was end of

what did he mean by that what did he

lila set back on her birth she pulled

suddenly came a huge
she screamed
